descript.abstract: Observations of large-scale changes in oceanic PC02 and supporting data of oceanographic properties and carbonate chemistry. May also include other lines and other projects (Line Z, Line R, Line PE, JGOFS, WOCE, Seamounts, Alaskan Gyre, Eddy, ).
descript.purpose: Determination of the penetration of CO2 into the water column.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years) Impact of Loss: High Recommended Action: Obtain access to data and bring to archives Additional Info: Freon data have been partly published; data will be made available after publication. PCO2 data (1973-1999) have been sent to the OSAP archive. Much of the productivity and chlorophyll data have been published, will be made available. DOC data are in press, and will be made available. DON data have been written up into a paper which has not yet been submitted for publication. TCO2 and Talkalinity profiles have been made available (1972-1997) and TCO2 and Talkalinity surface data (1972-1990) have been made available. C13 and O-18 data are custody of C.S. Wong. Storage Requirements: 50MB+unknown

dataqual.logic: Standardization of chemical instrumentation with known or commercially prepared standards.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Some DOC data are questionable. Meteorological data from NOAA buoy at Station P no longer freely available. Portable met. station on ship gives apparent measures of wind speed and direction for PCO2, must be corrected for ship`s heading, speed, etc. PCO2 originally measured by IR spectrophotometer, then by gas chromatograph, now using a non-dispersive IR analyzer. C13 and O-18 data are custody of C.S. Wong. Electronic Data Complications: Temperature, salinity, oxygen and nutrient data on IOS archived database are not quite conforming to IOS Header format, and are therefore difficult to search. All of the magtapes are older than their guaranteed physical lifespan. The last attempt to retrieve data from a magtape was successful (July 7, 2000).
